name: Frequency: Prior to commencing any activity
Acceptance Criteria: Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are:
– using the correct and complete set of drawings
– all drawings are the latest revision
– Conflicting documents: The project specific drawings to superceed the specification
Reference Documents: Drawings and drawing registers
Record of conformity: This ITP Signed
1.2 - Implementation of all measures and controls
Frequency: Prior to commencing any activity
Acceptance Criteria: All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: PSP, EMP, TMP, SWMS & WP
Reference Documents: OHSMP, EMP, TMS,  SWMS, WP
Record of conformity: This ITP Signed
Frequency: Prior to works commencing, 1 per delivery
Acceptance Criteria: Pipe class and size and endwall type as per stormwater drainage details and pit schedule
• All concrete pipes shall conform to AS 4058 and subsequent amendments
• All concrete pipes shall be spigot and socket rubber ring joint type
Record of conformity: This ITP Signed, Order acceptance certificate
2.2 - Precast Reinforced Concrete Inlet and Outlet Structures supply
Acceptance Criteria: The supply of precast inlet and outlet structures shall conform with stormwater drainage details and pit schedule
• Concrete shall conform to AS 3600 and shall be supplied by a concrete supplier conforming with AS 1379.
• Concrete shall have a characteristic strength of 32 MPa and maximum aggregate size of 20mm.
• Concrete strength shall be tested in accordance with Section 20.4 of AS 3600.
• Steel reinforcing shall comply with AS4671:2001
• Structural steel shall comply with the requirements of AS 4100.
Reference Documents: DWG EW-CE-DRW-526-001 C.4.6a C.4.6e
Record of conformity: This ITP Signed, Recievable Inspection Checklist
Acceptance Criteria: Bedding and Backfilling of trench to be in accordance with drawing EW-CE-DRW-526-001
• Bedding shall be 75mm Class 3 FCR compacted to refusal using hand held mechanical equipment.
Record of conformity: This ITP Signed, Quarry test report
Acceptance Criteria: Position of culverts confirmed with the superintendent prior to commencement of excavation
Record of conformity: Survey records, pegs on ground & this ITP Signed
Acceptance Criteria: The line of cut for each side of the trench shall be marked out on the surface before excavation commences.
• Trenches shall be kept free from water, debris and falling earth.

• The final trimming of the bottom 150mm of trench excavation must not be carried out until immediately prior to concreting or placing of pipe bedding. Excavation must be completed for a minimum of 10 metres length ahead of pipe laying.
Record of conformity: This ITP Signed
Acceptance Criteria: Superintendent shall Witness excavation prior to bedding or laying pipes, confirm pipe is placed at correct alignment
Record of conformity: This ITP Signed
Acceptance Criteria: Trench bedding shall be 75mm Class 3 FCR compacted to refusal using hand held mechanical equipment for all plavement types.
Inspection / Test Method: Visual inspection / Measure
Record of conformity: This ITP Signed
Acceptance Criteria: Huanching layer to be placed reaching a height equal to 30% of nominal pipe diameter
• Haunch Zone to be compacted to refusal using hand held mechanical equipment
Record of conformity: This ITP Signed
Acceptance Criteria: All pipes shall be set in a straight line between access chambers or between access chambers and headwalls.
• On inspection by the Superintendant, any pipe not placed in a straight line shall be replaced at the cost of the Contractor.
• Pipes shall be set in an upstream direction unless otherwise approved by the uperintendent.

• When laying rubber ring jointed pipes the first pipe in every run of drain shall be firmly staked in position before the remainder of the line is laid. At periods of delay in laying the ends of the pipe shall be adequately fixed to prevent joint creep.
Record of conformity: This ITP Signed
Acceptance Criteria: Pipes shall be jointed with rubber rings.

• Both spigot and socket shall be carefully cleaned of all dirt and foreign material.  A clean rubber ring shall be used, accurately guided and centred on the socket and forced into place using appropriate lever tools where necessary.
• The joint shall be checked with a gauge to ensure that the rubber ring has travelled uniformly home.  Defective joints shall be immediately remade.
Record of conformity: This ITP Signed
Acceptance Criteria: Drainage pits shall be in accordance with the stormwater drainage details and pit schedule.
Record of conformity: This ITP Signed
Acceptance Criteria: The horizontal deviation of any piped or box culverted drain shall not exceed 25mm from the true alignment. There shall be no obvious sharp changes of direction.
• The maximum deviation from grade shall not exceed + or - 10mm for grades flatter than 1 in 500 and + or - 20mm for grades steeper than 1 in 500.
• The grade of any piped, box culverted, or open drain shall not exceed + or - 5% for grades flatter than 1 in 500 and + or - 10% for grades steeper than 1 in 500.
• Invert levels at structures shall not exceed + or - 10mm from the design invert.
Record of conformity: This ITP Signed
Acceptance Criteria: Inspection by Superintendant of installed pipes prior to backfilling.
Record of conformity: This ITP Signed
• Excavated backfill to be 200mm above top of pipe
• From 200mm above pipe to 150mm below surface - Excavated material compacted in 150mm layers to the density of the adjacent soil.
• Haunching to 30% of pipe nominal diameter
• Backfill material to the base of the pavement
Record of conformity: This ITP Signed
4.3 - Testing and Acceptance of Fill Materials
Frequency: 1 per layer per drain line.  Test at each layer, near access chambers and along line.
Acceptance Criteria: Bedding and backfill materials shall be placed and compacted in layers not exceeding 150mm loose thickness and shall be assessed for compaction and moisture content.
• Bedding shall be compacted to refusal using hand held mechanical equipment.
• Backfill material with nominal size < 40mm after compaction shall be compacted to a mean density ratio of not less than 97% CDR.
• Backfill material with a swell equal to or greater than 2.5% shall be maintained at a mean moisture ratio of 92% between the completion of rolling and the placement of the overlying layer.
Record of conformity: Compaction Test Result OR This ITP Signed
Acceptance Criteria: All stormwater inlet and outlet connections shall be cut trimmed neat and finished with cementitious mortar.
Record of conformity: This ITP Signed

Acceptance Criteria: The survey shall include all invert levels at access chambers, entry pits, headwalls and endwalls, centre to centre distance of pits, distances from centre of pits to headwalls or endwalls, size of pipes, types of pipes and bedding, location of pits in relation to adjacent boundaries, reduced levels of access chamber and entry pit covers.
• Lot Maps shall be completed to show the extent of works for each lot.
Record of conformity: This ITP Signed
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
